page.title: 01Marwick & Boardhouse
page.content: The block is an area of low rounded hills with sizeable areas of wet, boggy ground and of open loch. The east and north are intensively farmed with beef cattle (wintered indoors) and sheep. Some cereals are grown as well as root vegetables and fodder crops. The virtual absence of trees gives a very open feel to the landscape. A RSPB reserve occupies a sizeable piece of the centre. "The Loons", with its viewing platform specializes in resident and migrating water birds. In the south is a part of a seconed world airfield. Once a Royal Navy base it is now used by grazing cattle. The loch of Broadhouse provide drinking water for a large part of North Mainland. A pumping station on the shore pumps the water to a storage tank on Ravie Hill whence it is distributed.
